page.title: 19RURAL MINISTRY MIDDLE RASEN
page.content: Rural Ministry within the Church of England in the latter years of the 20th century is entirely different in conditions and situation from that of former years. Whereas, in years past each village church could usually support its own benefice through the media of glebe, patronage and fees, the present situation is one of multiple parishes grouped together as a unit under the cure of one clergyman. This has been brought about basically by 2 factors:- 1. Forces occasioned by increasing industrialisation and the resulting vast economic changes. This meant that glebe and patronage were no longer sufficient to provide for clergy and family. 2. Urbanisation. The newly created parishes did not have the traditional benefit of glebe and patronage.
